text: growing up I had always thought that we
Americans we're at the top of the
pyramid and the rest of the world was
trying to be like us
I had always thought that the American
Dream was the only dream the best dream
but then I took my first trip overseas
in 2012 and a hundred and forty
countries later I realized that people
outside of the United States are just as
smart just as motivated and they dream
just as big as we do 11 official
languages I've seen a man in an Amana
Nagase Micaiah linen lock Achilles son
who asked me to make this video
ohm Bach Davis skeleton instead of
ricotta face yet Abajo a little bit a
boo boo sir a man named yogi Nina in
xanthi boo boo boo c2 even in the
smallest countries like Germany Bhutan
and Jordan I am constantly meeting
incredibly smart and talented people who
have never even been to the US and then
there's China and India whose three
billion combined citizens are gaining a
competitive edge on global leadership
and innovation this just proves that you
don't need a degree from an American
University to be successful in
timor-leste I met a guy named NASA who
started an LGBT Pride movement to his
country and it's been a driving factor
in the progression of his nation in
Bangkok I met a marriage who started a
co-working space called hubba and turned
it into one of the biggest startup
networks in the country in Hong Kong I
met Natalie who started own Academy
which helps students unlock their
passion and potential with creativity
and entrepreneurship she is changing
lives but let me make something clear
this is not a video to bash the United
States or anyone's American dream I'm
not saying that an education in the u.s.
is not valuable because it certainly is
I love my country more than anything in
the world and I will always support it
but the truth is that many Americans are
living in a bubble like I did and are
oblivious to the outside world I made
this video to share my perspective that
all people on our planet regardless of
ethnicity religion and economic
class are all talented in their own
unique ways
